clues.text: In Japan you use the broad end of these utensils to pick up food from a communal dish
As a noun, it's a wire utensil for beating eggs; as a verb, it means to move quickly
A taste of home cookbook of "Soups, Stews & More" mentions this utensil & 300+ recipes on its cover
A sieve is good for getting the clumps out of flour; you can use this hole-y bowl-shaped utensil for straining pasta or rinsing lettuce
Pizza cutters are for more than just pizza! Chop herbs & make strips of pastry for this fancy top for a pie crust
Grain, cheese & dust are types of these tiny (really, really tiny!) arthropods
SCN is short for this crop's "cyst nematode", a roundworm that may be kept in check by rotating the crop with corn
Many rotifers have regal tufts of cilia that draw water into their mouths; the structure goes by this name, like a layer of the Sun
Some mini cnidarians that can regenerate parts of their bodies have this mythic name, like a creature fought by Hercules
AKA a water bear or moss piglet, this poster child of charismatic microfauna has survived exposure to the vacuum of space
Until 1935 this body didn't have its own building; it met in the Old Senate Chamber, & members ate lunch in the Robing Room
The oldest committee in the House, it's been charting revenue policy since 1789
The mission statement of this Cabinet department begins, "With honor and integrity, we will safeguard the American people"
Created in 1939, the Executive Office of the President is overseen by this person, a position created in 1946
Until 1967 & the 25th Amendment, VP succession to the presidency was based on precedent named for this man, the first to do it
Relating to a time between ancient & modern--Weird Al warned he'd "get" this "on your heinie" in "Amish Paradise"
An avian term for a person who thirsts for a scrap, it was used of congressmen elected before the Scrap of 1812
This 9-letter adjective for someone itching to fight comes from Latin for "of war"
Throwing hands & then eating together? That's not friendly fire but the alliterative friendly this slang word for a fight
A snack & a body part are in this idiom about someone always ready to take offense

rounds.category: MEYER SCHUSSER, IRASCIBLE REFUGEE COMPOSER OF GOLDEN AGE HOLLYWOOD
rounds.comments: (Ken: Bet he gets up to some crazy adventures.)

clues.text: MGM sent a man they call an arranger--I could do as well with any bricklayer from this city of Schubert, Strauss & Schusser
So, young man, you studied with that Schoenberg fellow at this university in Westwood? Better to learn in a honky tonk on Central Ave.
Ach! I belch better than you play this single-reed woodwind that evolved from the chalumeau; out with you!
I am scoring a historical drama set at the French court of Louis XV of this royal house; we will not have a "catchy swing number"
On the screen, the children frolic; in the studio, the violins play this way, plucking their strings! That is the magic of Schusser
If you like pi√±a coladas, you'd better lay in a supply of light this, the base liquor
Add a shot of Grand Marnier to a margarita & you're having it this high-end style, & hopefully not driving one
A Manhattan uses vermouth & whiskey; a Bronx, vermouth & this booze, plus some OJ so it's not just a martini
In 1883 a bartender told the Chicago Tribune his patrons preferred this American whiskey to bourbon in their old-fashioneds
A classic Aperol spritz gets its spritziness from club soda & this Italian sparkling wine
To Alexander Pope this "springs eternal in the human breast: man never is, but always to be blessed"
To Horace, "Dulce et decorum est pro patria mori", it is lovely & honorable to die for this; WWI poet Wilfred Owen called that a lie
Carroll critter who said, "The time has come... to talk of many things: of shoes--& ships--& sealing wax--of cabbages & kings"
"Her hair was long, her foot was light, and her eyes were wild" is Keats on this belle dame who is without pity, not without thanks
In "Tropic of Cancer", he wrote, "I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive"

clues.text: It can mean volume or space, but also mental ability
ethereum.org can help you design & issue your own one of these; you might need to write code in Python
The opposite of voluntary, it's from the Latin for "to force"
In one sense the opposite of union, it's actually a synonym for union
In a candle the melted wax is carried upward via this type of "action" in the wick
Aye, Scottish ethnology is a full undergraduate program at the University of this capital
Australia's oldest university was founded in the 19th century in this city, on land of the Gadigal people
College football coach Duffy Daugherty: "I could have been a" this, (getting a free ride to Oxford) "except for my grades"
Justin Trudeau went way out West & was a snowboard bum while getting a B. Ed. degree from the University of this province
In 1589 Galileo became Chair of Mathematics at the University of this but soon found himself in motion to Padua
Magic, schmagic! The Russo kids must deal with hordes of geckos & skinks
Hugh Laurie goes full rodent at the Princeton-Plainsboro Teaching Hospital & he's addicted to all the cheese
Richie, Fonzie, Potsie & Ralph Malph gather to sing the opening word of the "Banana Boat Song"
Murderous blood-splatter specialist Michael C. Hall is addicted to his cell phone & can't stop messaging
Ben Bailey is back in the taxi-based game show biz; no money though--your prize is an itchy skin condition
Book about Bligh & Fletcher Christian & job pursuing criminals for reward as a gonzo journalist of note

clues.text: Nation's top lawyer & a poultry dish named for a mighty Chinese military man combine for some truly illegible handwriting

clues.text: "Madama Butterfly" heroine crooning in Costa Rica's capital with a glass of gold tequila from a well-known brand

clues.text: In ecology this 5-letter word refers to an area such as a desert or forest with its unique variety of life
This fibrous protein that makes up your hair & nails is also a major component of an animal's claws, hooves & feathers
Fish, mammals & even spiders secrete these chemicals that allow them to communicate with members of their own species
A neuron is made up of 3 basic parts: a cell body, an axon & these treelike filaments
DNA consists of these smaller units that bond together in long chains called poly-these

rounds.text: He was riding back from the conquest of Granada when he was summoned to a royal meeting that would change history
